review_body: I've been using this tool kit for a few months now and it has worked wonderfully. It does what I need it to do. The only problem that I had was that the polishing wheels disintegrated almost instantly. And it better labelling of the individual bits and collets would have been nice. Doesn't seem to have all of the collets that you need.

product_name: - Northern Industrial Tools 245-Pc. Rotary Tool Kit - RP2145CK
review_body: WOW this was a really great set, the small dremel is somewhat cheezy but it gets the job done!

product_name: - Northern Industrial Tools 245-Pc. Rotary Tool Kit - RP2145CK
review_header: You get what you pay for and not a tool for a heavy user or someone that needs to change bits often
review_body: Not sure how this gets so many great reviews. It's definitely a "get what you pay for" product. It does it's job OK in most instances but the motor does not have the power nor the longevity of a Dremel. If you need to do one little project this will be fine. No doubt Dremel is way overpriced, too. The bits alone make this worth the price. But here's the issues I've had:1) Original purchase had broken latches - replaced no problem at store2) Original purchase had problem with mini tool, spun off center - replaced no problem at store3) Claims that it works with all Dremel accessories - UNTRUE! - probably works with most bits but DOES NOT interchange with collects, flex shaft, or other attachments4) LED light can not be used with flex shaft5) Motor is underpowered and will bog down when drilling with an 1/8" bit in soft plastic6) Collets - changing them is horrible and they don't even have all the sizes needed to use all of the included accessories7) Motor speed is inconsistent even when there is no loadSo, again, you get what you pay for. It's a lot of pieces for the price and will work great for a small project or two. But, if you need to change bits regularly then look elsewhere. And the handy Dremel screw chuck collect DOES NOT fit on here, nor do any other Dremel collects. This tool has a slightly larger diameter where the collect nut attaches both on the main tool and on the business end of the flex shaft. I've heard rumors of and adapter but have yet to find one.

product_name: - Northern Industrial Tools 245-Pc. Rotary Tool Kit - RP2145CK
review_body: work great limited in some ways but great for house hold use and tinkering

product_name: - Northern Industrial Tools 245-Pc. Rotary Tool Kit - RP2145CK
review_body: Get things found inside the box is damaged, so I doubt if he is used, at least that sell goods stores do not carry out inspection, I feel a little disappointed.

review_header: Air compressor arrived with safety cage crushed, as it ...
review_body: Air compressor arrived with safety cage crushed,as it was dropped on the top. After two weeks no response from the shipper-supplier.

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_body: [[VIDEOID:da2258d5cc3eb6525e2c7d56c00b3918]] My first compressor was delivered smashed and leaking oil so I denied delivery.It was about two weeks till the replacement arrived.The replacement has a few minor issues that I address in the video so at this time I'm unable to run it.

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_body: made well. Good for small stuff. noise like any other.

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_body: This compressor is a welcome upgrade to the smaller one that I have used for years in my multi-purpose workshop. The unit itself is generally well constructed, with balanced capacities for the motor, compressor and tank. Assembly consisted only of the simple mounting of the wheels, air filters and cart handle. The only glitch with the assembly was the failure of a tack weld on one of the nuts that secures the cart handle. Also on the down side, the unit comes wired to operate on 110V, but no instruction is included for configuring it to run on the optionally offered 220V. Having to pay shop time for an electrician to reconfigure the wiring will negate the cost advantage of this compressor over similar units offered elsewhere. Apart from these non-critical elements, the compressor is well made and, since I don't intend to use it to run continuous demand tools such as air sanders, its performance satisfies all of my needs.

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_header: For the money I paid for this compressor it was a very good deal. I wish I could have found this ...
review_body: Does not have air leaks for at least a week, even with tools plugged in. Very quite and builds air quick. It's heavy to be moving around much. For the money I paid for this compressor it was a very good deal. I wish I could have found this compressor years ago.

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_body: My first impression of this unit upon my initial use of it is that it is about the best compressor performance for the price (price per listed CFM at 90 psi - when compared against similar performing units by Ingersoll-Rand, Craftsman, Makita and Industrial Air) that I think one could expect before going to a larger unit wired for 220/240 or gas-powered.  This unit is the perfect choice for the homeowner looking for an upgrade to a smaller pancake or other portable unit.  Assembly was simple and was essentially complete after bolting on the wheels and attaching the handle.  Order the compressor oil also unless you want to make a separate trip to Home Depot or Lowe's to get that before you can plug it in and turn it on.  I was particularly intrigued to see just how quiet it would be, as that was noted in the product details and one feature that mattered to me.  It is indeed quiet compared to the little screamer portable that I had been using.  The dark charcoal, fine-wrinkle finish on the unit appears very durable and was frankly more appealing to me than a typical painted finish.  Other thoughtful details on this compressor include a properly located air-release valve at the bottom of the tank near the right side that make it very simple to open and drain off any moisture or excess air before storage.  If I had a gripe, it'd be that the air-connector is immediately connected to the gauge, and that made it a little more difficult to unscrew the connector from the gauge-body so that I could hard pipe a filter/separator in-line before the connector.  This is due to the lack of a good purchase-point to stick a wrench that will allow for removal of the connector fitting from the gauge-body, as the gauge-dial makes it too tall to allow one to rotate it with the gauge still on it and unscrew it from the unit.  Anyway, the issue won't likely affect anyone not needing particularly dry air.  Finally, although I would guess that NorthStar imports this unit (from Puma perhaps),as the bolts are all metric and don't appear to be quite up to that of American ASTM grade threads.  Frankly, these are relatively little things and wouldn't deter me from strongly recommending this compressor to any friend looking for the same things that I was - good performance for the homeowner-level user for the best price.  Great unit here from NorthStar!

product_name: - NorthStar Belt Drive Single-Stage Portable Air Compressor - 2 HP, 20-Gallon, Vertical, 5.0 CFM
review_body: Been using for a few weeks now, great compressor couldn't be happier

product_name: #1 CutRite Hot Knife Kit , 4" & 6" Straight Blades & Case
review_header: Made In China - 15 seconds at a time only.
review_body: This was bought about 18 months ago for very infrequent usage, once or twice per week for a few moments at a time to cut some webbing.  I thought I had bought the top quality tool that would last a long time.  We used it the other day to cut several pieces at once to build up stock.  It made it through about a dozen cuts, then died.  During examination, I noticed that there is a small label that says to use it for 15 seconds at a time only.  And another that says Made in China.  For the money, I expected neither of these.  My fault for not noticing, but I wouldn't consider buying another one.  You can get this kind of quality for a lot less money.

review_header: Very simple knife. Carbon steel blade. Anyone that ...
review_body: Very simple knife. Carbon steel blade. Anyone that knows knives knows this is a classic.Mall ninjas go elsewhere, this isnt a spiderco.

product_name: #7 Opinel Carbon Steel Folding Knife w/ Beechwood Handle and Leather Sheath
review_header: and really I could not be happier. Let's get the first bit out of the ...
review_body: I've owned a number of knives, from $400 Fallknivens to $20 Gerbers, and plenty in-between.  I just took delivery of my first Opinel (oh-peen-el, in case you were wondering) 3 days ago, and I am very impressed. I did a lot of reading on these before I made my purchase, and really I could not be happier. Let's get the first bit out of the way, from an aesthetic point, this will be one of the most beautiful knives you will ever own. It's rustic and simplistic appearance belies its strength and capability. The beech wood handle is gorgeous, and has a nice shape, which is very comfortable to hold. I didn't buy this knife to impress others, but it has to be said, every time I have offered it up for another's request of "anybody have a knife?" The next word usually heard is "wow".It's very light, yet balanced. The blade has zero play on any axis when deployed, and locks confidently in or out. The blade wasn't shaving sharp out of the box, but fairly close, and easy enough to bring up to standard with a dry stone. Being the knife that it is, there are no clips or loops to attach to anything, but it hardly matters. It's quite small enough to slide into the coin pocket of your Levi's and stay secure throughout the day.I have rather large hands, so I included a photo of the #7 Opinel on my iPad for a sizing reference. I was torn between 7 or 8, but I could not be happier with the 7 as my EDC. I believe the 8 will be a bit too large for coin pocket carry, and I prefer not to have a large knife in my front pocket where it is visible to others. I will be ordering more sizes very soon, as there is a size and style for most anyone out there, and at these price points, why not? $14 with shipping is an absolute steal for such a quality knife. And even if you don't like it, you can always gift it to someone who would appreciate it, and you wouldn't feel too bad about losing those 14 dollars.Hope you enjoy your new Opinel!

product_name: #7 Opinel Carbon Steel Folding Knife w/ Beechwood Handle and Leather Sheath
review_body: razor sharp love it!

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: The best bits ever.  Fit Phillips fasteners perfectly. No stripping of screw head. Bought 4 packs. Glad to find these on Amazon.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: Buy these every so often because I break regular bits daily. These last me weeks.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: These bits are amazing, bulletproof, and by far the strongest long lasting bit I have ever used.  I am a carpenter I was given a ACR bit 4 or 5 years ago that got unintentionally electrically welded into a driver making it unique & I was able to hold on to it for 4+ years.  I was able to bend it when I dropped a drill 2 stories Obliterated the drill but the bit still works (wobbles) but in 4 years time I  screwed together 25+ decks 5 boat houses, Countless sheets of sheet rock and seriously at least 30,000 screws ... Looking to replace the wobbly bit I ordered the hammer steel and hardend steel bits but they wore out on 15 to 20 screws.. I finally found the ACR bit & Thank you Philips!  Quality A+ in my book best product out there!  Please keep doing things the way you are.. don't sell out

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: these are great because they have serrations on the tips that help prevent cam-out.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_header: Outstanding is probably the one word I can use to ...
review_body: Outstanding is probably the one word I can use to describe this product. I only review 5 star products and 1 star products. This one is a 5. Installed a complete 20'X20' deck using a box of 3000 screws with ONE, I repeat ONE OF THESE BITS including stripping out about 100 heads off of the screw itself.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: I use these bits in place of regular #2 Phillips.The coating has never let them rust and I've never broken one. I have a dozen or so in all of my tool bags/boxes that have drills or drivers and they've never let me down. I used to go through regular uncoated #2 bits constantly and was sick of buying replacements.I've never found these in a store and they were recommended by a friend. Worth the the money!

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: I really like these bits. The serrated tips really do hold the screws well and cam-out less than regular bits. I also use their 1" bits which have the same tip design.  These bits are durable and I appreciate that too.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_header: Grip better than bits costing four times as much
review_body: Grip better than bits costing four times as much. Still like the Rhino bits better though.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: Good product at a great price.

product_name: (3-80202) #2 Phillips with ACR Bit 2" 6pk
review_body: Wow, I don't believe how much better these bits resist cam-out over the regular bits I've been using.  I'm definitely a convert to the ACR line of bits!

product_name: (4) LED Black Structured
review_body: The brightness is a good bit more than I expected for LEDs. Walking out at night in near pitch blackness, no problem seeing where your going, and pointing your head at door locks etc. Beats carrying a flash-light, you have both hands free!

product_name: (4) LED Black Structured
review_body: I have several older dogs and one doesn't see very well at night so I use this hat to help her navigate around the yard. It keeps my hands free to do other things - keep her away from obstacles, pick up waste, etc. Note - you might want to order extra batteries when you order the hat. They do drain fairly quickly.

product_name: (4) LED Black Structured
review_body: As expected

product_name: (4) LED Black Structured
review_body: At first, I thought that I had the wrong hat. As it had plainly indicated in the adv. that the hat was "structured". On the contrary, if you happen to purchase their version of a hunter's power cap, that one is structured in the sense that the front half of the whole cap is very firm. This particular hat is not "structured" in that the entire cap up to its bill is just simply cloth that one could roll up. In that it did not compare in "structure" at all to their hunter's cap sort of let me down. Otherwise, it is a very good cap for jogging when there is not much daylight, changing fuses, etc.

review_body: Great price for these bulbs, and they work great! I think the big brands should watch out.

review_body: great product, no issues yet.

product_name: (Pack Of 10) MR16/FL - Flood- 12V - MR16 - GU5.3 Bi-Pin Base - Light Bulb With Lens - MR16
review_header: These are the same lights that our low voltage kitchen ...
review_body: These are the same lights that our low voltage kitchen lights use for a fraction of the price... just because they are for outdoor use?  This is our third order and we've never had a problem using them inside or outside.

product_name: (Pack Of 10) MR16/FL - Flood- 12V - MR16 - GU5.3 Bi-Pin Base - Light Bulb With Lens - MR16
review_body: A third were DOA. :(

product_name: (Pack Of 10) MR16/FL - Flood- 12V - MR16 - GU5.3 Bi-Pin Base - Light Bulb With Lens - MR16
review_body: Seems to be a good bulb and a good price ...

product_name: (Pack Of 10) MR16/FL - Flood- 12V - MR16 - GU5.3 Bi-Pin Base - Light Bulb With Lens - MR16
review_body: Bulbs arrived in a nice 10 pack, each in an individual box, all wrapped together.  I seem to go through these pretty regularly, I cant speak to this brand's longevity yet but they seem bright and with a consistent color and brightness between them.Not much else to say, they are just light-bulbs after all.

product_name: (Pack Of 10) MR16/FL - Flood- 12V - MR16 - GU5.3 Bi-Pin Base - Light Bulb With Lens - MR16
review_body: Much cheaper than B&M and even some websites.  We are finding the bulbs hard to install in our track but once they are in there everything's great.
